Package bricker.brick_strategies

Class BasicCollisionStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • bricker.brick_strategies.BasicCollisionStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CollisionStrategy
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CameraChangeStrategy, DoublePowersStrategy, ExtraBallsStrategy, ExtraLifeStrategy, ExtraPaddleStrategy
    public class BasicCollisionStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements CollisionStrategy
    BasicCollisionStrategy implements the CollisionStrategy interface to provide a basic response to collisions in the game. This strategy is fundamental and typically involves the removal of the colliding object, thereby affecting the game's state. It is a modular strategy that can be applied in various scenarios where simple collision handling is required, such as deleting bricks upon collision. This strategy forms the basis for more complex collision behaviors in the game. Usage: - Instantiate this class with a reference to the GameObjectCollection. - Attach this strategy to a GameObject. - Upon collision, the attached GameObject will be removed, and the relevant game counters will be updated.
    Version:
    Java 11
    Author:
    Noam Shabat, Samuel Hayat

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicCollisionStrategy

        public BasicCollisionStrategy​(danogl.collisions.GameObjectCollection admin)
        Constructs a BasicCollisionStrategy instance. Initializes the strategy with a reference to the GameObjectCollection which manages the game objects. This collection is used to remove bricks from the game.
        Parameters:
        admin - The GameObjectCollection instance managing the game objects and overall game logic.

    • Method Detail

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag()
        Returns a unique tag identifying this specific strategy. The tag is an ID of this object and is used to identify an instance of this class
        Specified by:
        getTag in interface CollisionStrategy
        Returns:
        A string representing the unique tag of this collision strategy.

      • onCollision

        public void onCollision​(danogl.GameObject thisObj,
                        danogl.GameObject otherObj,
                        danogl.util.Counter bricksCounter,
                        boolean originalBehavior)
        Handles the collision event according to the basic collision strategy. This method is invoked when an object implementing this strategy collides with another object.
        Specified by:
        onCollision in interface CollisionStrategy
        Parameters:
        thisObj - The GameObject associated with this collision strategy.
        otherObj - The GameObject that has collided with thisObj.
        bricksCounter - A counter tracking the number of bricks in the game, which is decremented upon collision.
        originalBehavior - A boolean flag indicating whether the original behavior of the collision should also occur.
